name: Burkholderia pseudomallei Encephalomyelitis
chief_complaint: I've had fever, confusion, and weakness in my legs for the past 10 days

lab_results.CSF analysis: lymphocytic pleocytosis (120 cells/mm3), elevated protein (80 mg/dL), normal glucose
lab_results.MRI spine: longitudinal T2 hyperintensity from T4 to conus medullaris

treatment: intravenous ceftazidime (or meropenem) for minimum 4 weeks
prognosis: Guarded - 30-40% mortality even with treatment, survivors often have residual neurological deficits
description: A rare neurological manifestation of melioidosis where Burkholderia pseudomallei invades the central nervous system, causing both encephalitis and myelitis. Typically seen in endemic regions (Southeast Asia, Northern Australia) but may present in travelers. The spinal cord involvement often mimics transverse myelitis or Guillain-Barr√© syndrome initially.
risk_factors: residence or travel to endemic areas
